snippet: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission questioned substitute measures to control a blaze at the nuclear power facility in Westchester County.
abstract: Nuclear Regulatory Commission reports that it does not have any immediate concerns about the safety of Entergy's Indian Point nuclear power plant in New York, but submits a 98-page letter of safety concerns, including a rejection of some of its procedures for assuring fire safety; report is likely to add ammunition to an effort by Gov Andrew M Cuomo to close the plant when its original 40-year operating licenses for the reactors expire in 2012 and 2015.
lead_paragraph: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission questioned substitute measures to control a blaze at the nuclear power facility in Westchester County.

headline.seo: Indian Point Fire Safety Plan Rejected by Regulators
headline.main: Agency Rejects Indian Point Fire Safety Plan
headline.print_headline: Agency Rejects Indian Pt. Plan For Fire Safety
